q3.description: Previously we saw that we need to remove lambda productions to avoid running into an infinite loop when using brute force expansion of the derivation tree if the string is not in the language of the grammar.
q3.question: Which of the following is a lambda production?

q4.description: $\textbf{Theorem}$ (remove $\lambda$ productions): Let $G$ be a CFG with $\lambda$ not in L(G). Then there exists a CFG $G'$ having no $\lambda$-productions such that $L(G)=L(G')$.
q4.question: Removing lamda in this case will change the grammar

q5.description: $\textbf{Theorem}$ (remove $\lambda$ productions): Let $G$ be a CFG with $\lambda$ not in L(G). Then $\exists$ a CFG $G'$ having no $\lambda$-productions such that $L(G)=L(G')$.
q5.question: In case $\lambda$ is in $L(G)$, removing lamda in this case will change the grammar
q5.answer: Yes, it will produce a language without the string $\lambda$
choices: Yes, it will produce a language without the string $\lambda$

q7.question: For the grammar on the left, what productions generate lambda directly?

q8.description:
To remove $\lambda$-productions
1. Let $V_n = \{A \mid \exists\ \mbox{production}\ A \rightarrow \lambda\}$
2. Repeat until no more additions
$*\quad$if $B \rightarrow A_1A_2 \ldots A_m$ and $A_i \in V_n$ for all $i$ then put $B$ in $V_n$
In other words, add $B$ to $V_n$ if it has a production with a RHS where all variables exist in $V_n$. Such a variable also produces $\lambda$
q8.question: Should we add more variables to $V_n$?

q9.description:
To remove $\lambda$-productions
1. Let $V_n = \{A \mid \exists\ \mbox{production}\ A \rightarrow \lambda\}$
2. Repeat until no more additions
$*\quad$if $B \rightarrow A_1A_2 \ldots A_m$ and $A_i \in V_n$ for all $i$ then put $B$ in $V_n$
In other words, add $B$ to $V_n$ if it has a production with a RHS where all variables exist in $V_n$. Such a variable also produces $\lambda$
q9.question: After we finish the second step, $V_n$ contains all variables that produce $\lambda$

q10.description:
To remove $\lambda$-productions
1. Let $V_n = \{A \mid \exists\ \mbox{production}\ A \rightarrow \lambda\}$
2. Repeat until no more additions
$*\quad$if $B \rightarrow A_1A_2 \ldots A_m$ and $A_i \in V_n$ for all $i$ then put $B$ in $V_n$
3. Construct $G'$ with productions $P'$ such that
$*\quad$ if $A \rightarrow x_1x_2\ldots x_m \in P, m \ge 1$ then put all productions formed when $x_j$ is replaced by $\lambda$ (for all $x_j\in V_n$) such that $|rhs|\ge 1$ into $P'$.
q10.question: First, we need to copy all productions that do not produce $\lambda$ to the new grammar. Select all of them

q11.description:
To remove $\lambda$-productions
1. Let $V_n = \{A \mid \exists\ \mbox{production}\ A \rightarrow \lambda\}$
2. Repeat until no more additions
$*\quad$if $B \rightarrow A_1A_2 \ldots A_m$ and $A_i \in V_n$ for all $i$ then put $B$ in $V_n$
3. Construct $G'$ with productions $P'$ such that
$*\quad$ if $A \rightarrow x_1x_2\ldots x_m \in P, m \ge 1$ then put all productions formed when $x_j$ is replaced by $\lambda$ (for all $x_j\in V_n$) such that $|rhs|\ge 1$ into $P'$.
q11.question: Now, suppose that the variable $A$ will be substituted by $\lambda$, what will be the value of the highlighted production rule?
